page.title: 03MILL FARM BRANSCOMBE.
page.content: Mill Farm is in a valley between two streams. It is called Mill Farm because it has a mill driven by a water wheel, which was used until 70 years ago.It has still got the workings.Mill Farm is rented from the Nationel Trust by Mr and Mrs Denning. Mr Denning milks a heard of about 30 cows.The milk is sent to Honiton Express Dairys to be made into cheese, yoghurt, cream and butter.There are also 24 heifers and about 30 calves. Mr Denning takes his cattle to Axminster Market.In the winter the cows are fed hay which has been made from the fields in the summer.There are 112 acres of land at Mill Farm, some woodland but mostly rough pasture. Vistors come to stay for bed and breakfast in the summer at Mill Farm.
